deliverables.title: Media pitch for tech journalists
deliverables.description: Personalized pitch email to tech journalists covering enterprise software and AI. Email subject line emphasizes news hook: '3 Fortune 500 companies adopt new AI analytics platform - here's why legacy BI tools are failing'. Body: Lead with customer traction stat. Explain innovation angle (AI predictions + NLP queries). Offer CEO interview, customer introduction, product demo, and early access. Timing tie-in: launches same week as major BI vendor conference. Personalize with reporter's recent coverage. Keep under 250 words - journalists are busy. Clear call to action: respond for interview access.
acceptanceCriteria: Word count: 150-250 words (email format)

Personalization: References reporter's beat or recent article
News angle: Why this is relevant now (timing, market shift, customer pain)
Offers: CEO interview, customer intro, product demo
Call to action: Clear next step for reporter

deliverables.title: CEO media interview talking points
deliverables.description: Talking points for CEO media interviews during launch week. 5 key messages with supporting sub-points and data. Message 1: Market problem (enterprises drowning in data, need faster insights). Message 2: Our innovation (AI predictions + natural language eliminate technical barriers). Message 3: Customer proof (Fortune 500 adoption, specific time savings metrics). Message 4: Competitive differentiation (why traditional BI tools can't do this). Message 5: Vision (democratizing data analytics for all business users). Each message has 3-4 supporting sub-points with specific examples, customer quotes, or data. Includes bridging phrases to redirect difficult questions back to key messages. Notes section with potential tough questions and suggested responses.
acceptanceCriteria: 5 distinct key messages covering: problem, solution, proof, differentiation, vision
Each message has 3-4 supporting sub-points with specifics
Includes data points and metrics (time savings, adoption, ROI)
Customer examples or quotes included under proof message
Bridging phrases provided (e.g., 'What's more important is...', 'The real story here is...')
Tough questions section with 3-5 anticipated difficult questions
Suggested responses for tough questions that bridge back to key messages
Spokesperson guidance: tone (confident, data-driven), pacing (pause for impact)
Passes brand compliance
Readability score > 60
deliverables.notes: CEO: Sarah Chen. Media training scheduled for March 12. Focus on customer impact, not just technology. Anticipate questions about pricing, competition with Tableau/PowerBI, data security.
